page.title: 08UNEMPLOYMENT IN LOUGHBOROUGH
page.content: In Loughborough in May 1985 there were 3609 people unemployed and only 252 job vacancies left. In May 1984 there were 3492 people unemployed and only 141 job vacancies left.In May 1983 there were 3589 people unemployed and only 193 job vacancies left.We can't see any sign of Loughborough's unemployment problem getting any easier because neither the number of vacancies nor the number of jobs has changed very much in the last three years.The main factories in Loughborough are the Brush which makes electrical machines, generators and switchgear;Towles,Mansfield and Marthon which make knitwear and clothes.There's Rikers and Fisons which make chemicals and drugs and Herbert Morris which makes cranes.
